channel.title: Encryption on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Encryption on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Cashing In Early
item.description: Cryptocurrency is having a bit of a moment right now, thanks in no small part to bitcoin, the currency launched under unusual circumstances that has suddenly become really, really popular. (As I write this, it’s continuing its daylong flirtation with the $10,000 valuation mark.) But of course, while cryptocurrency is growing in popularity, bitcoin and other blockchain-based currencies can’t come close to making the claim to being the first digital currency.

item.title: Weirdest Ransom Note Ever
item.description: Back in the ’80s, it was a big deal when a frustrated satellite dish operator overrode the HBO feed for a few minutes on a Saturday night. But late last year, a saga involving a programmer whose family member’s TV set had fallen victim to ransomware shows we haven’t even scratched the surface of TV hacking. https://twitter.com/darrencauthon/status/813096722989809665 Ransomware has a long and sordid history, though it’s relatively new to television.
